newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China Eastern fixed assets valued at HK$14.12 bln.
newsitem.headline: China Eastern fixed assets valued at HK$14.12 bln.

text.p: Property consultants Chesterton Petty said on Thursday it valued China Eastern Airlines Corp Ltd's fixed assets at HK$14.12 billion.
Chesterton Petty advised China Eastern ahead of its recent dual listing in Hong Kong and New York.
The consultants included fixed assets such as land, buildings, plants, aircraft, vehicle equipment, spare engines and construction in progress in the valuation.

China Eastern Airlines owns or holds under capital leases 65 aircraft -- seven Airbus Industrie A300s, three A340s, two A310s, 10 Fokker F100s, five McDonnell Douglas MD11s, 13 MD82s and one MD11 freighter.
The rest of the aircraft are China-made Y7s and Y5s, Chesterton Petty said in a statement.
